meanings.definition: To spell better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outspell her classmates in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: I hope to outspell my opponent in the upcoming spelling competition.
meanings.sent3: The young girl challenged her friend to a spelling contest to see who could outspell the other.
meanings.sent4: In the world of spelling, she was able to outspell even the most experienced competitors.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outspell others made him a champion in spelling competitions.

meanings.sent1: He can outspell anyone in the class with his impressive spelling skills.
meanings.sent2: The student worked hard to outspell his previous best score in the spelling test.
meanings.sent3: The spelling prodigy continued to outspell everyone, leaving them amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her talent to outspell others was truly remarkable and admired by all.
meanings.sent5: The young boy's determination to outspell his rivals led him to victory in the spelling bee.
